Description: Small globular vase of marl pottery with small flat base, everted rim and two cylindrical pierced handles on the shoulder; decorated in faded red-brown paint on each side with a boat with many oars. Wavy lines are painted above, over and below the handles; a spiral is painted on the base. The rim top has double line encircling it.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s Decorated ware. One boat has a Z-sign standard, the other is worn. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 288.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Essie Winifred Newberry
